lexUnit.name: stop.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: discontinue an action, practice, or habit.

sentence.text: After all , I 'd only just stopped doing my paper-round and I heard them talking about headlong stuff I never knew about before : abortions , heroin , Sylvia Plath , prostitution .
Oh , if only she could stop crying …
To take one example , if Britain stopped burning fossil fuels altogether , the world 's output of carbon dioxide -- some 6 billion tonnes a year -- would fall by only 160 m tonnes .
The Office has stopped subsidising one-day energy surveys for industry and commerce and there is little accessible public information .
He stopped buying them for her when they got married .
Social services have stopped paying a £30 attendance allowance for Becky to go to Southampton once every two months for treatment .
They had almost stopped resuscitating him on the grounds that the doctor had n't remembered his diagnosis .
" And then , about four months ago , Mr. Andrew stopped coming to the office .
I stopped smoking two years ago and I stopped doing all the silly drugs and drink nearly six years ago , so you naturally gravitate towards quite a healthy diet .
Kenny Everett said : ` I stopped watching 10 years ago because it was hideously irritating .
He must have stopped falling pretty abruptly .
That 's something you find : after a certain age , people stop photographing you .
People stop having children when the future they face is too appalling .
He stopped reciting , he stopped walking .
The fliers immediately stopped their displays in respect for the dead man .
Stop the destruction of the rainforest with a gift to WWF .
